flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=960>>960.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=262>>262 games.
50% of these games means 50/100 * 262 games = <<50/100*262=131>>131 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 131 games * $7/game = $<<131*7=917>>917 on them.
The other 131 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him 131 games * $3/game = $<<131*3=393>>393.
On all games in total Daniel spent $960 + $917 + $393 = $<<960+917+393=2270>>2270.
#### 2270

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 266, not 262. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
